title: Paddle Your Way Through Historic Napa on This Kayak Tour
seo_title: Paddle Your Way Through Historic Napa on This Kayak Tour
long_description:
View Napa from a whole new perspective as you make your way down a section of the 55-mile long Napa River. The Napa River History Tour is a guided two-hour long kayak trip that will give you an in-depth look at Napa’s flora and fauna, history of notable buildings, and background of the famous wine region. Learn the significance of Napa’s historical sites both in regional and world history and discover the valley’s Native American past, early settlers, and ships that once navigated the river. Your Napa-native professional guide will provide fun and informative facts about the early days of Napa, including the California Gold Rush’s influence on the valley.

Explore Napa’s natural beauty alongside historical highlights. Paddlers have come across all sorts of wildlife native to Napa Valley. You may see turtles, several species of birds, geese, and herons, and deer and rabbit grazing on the riverbank. Maybe you’ll be lucky enough to spot a bald eagle, river otter, or a busy beaver hard at work.

No need to worry about your fitness level or kayaking skills, or lack thereof. Your guide will show beginners how to use a kayak in a stable and comfortable way. If you are a kayaking pro, you will be able to move ahead of the group to meet them at the next location.

Besides life jackets and paddles the tour guide will provide, there are other essentials to consider bringing on your day out on the water. Protect yourself from the sun with a sun-shielding hat, sunglasses, and sunscreen. Stay dry with neoprene footwear, a moisture-wicking shirt and shorts, and a floating dry bag for your wallet and phone. Stay hydrated while paddling in the hot Napa sun by packing plenty of water. For more information and booking, visit Napa River History Tour.

--

Stay with the Wine Country Inn in the heart of Napa Valley during your wine country vacation. Gear up for your Napa River excursion by indulging in our complimentary wine country breakfast.
